intro: Stephanophysum longifolium var. microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved stephanophysum, is a variant of the stephanophysum genus native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its diminutive, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a compact rosette. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered near the base of the foliage. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity.
